biography.summary: John Hoeven is an American politician serving as the senior United States Senator from North Dakota since 2011. He previously served as Governor of North Dakota (2000â€“2010).
biography.early_life: Born March 13, 1957, in Minot, North Dakota, Hoeven grew up in North Dakota and pursued higher education in business administration.
biography.education: Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, University of North Dakota.
biography.career: Before entering national politics, Hoeven was a businessman and banker in North Dakota and served as Governor of North Dakota from 2000 to 2010. He was elected to the U.S. Senate in 2010 and took office in 2011.

contact.office_address: 338 Russell Senate Office Building Washington DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Supports lower taxes and reducing federal deficits.
Advocates for North Dakota energy production and domestic energy development.
Supports farmers and rural development initiatives.

bills_sponsored.title: North Dakota Economic Growth and Infrastructure Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Aims to promote investment in infrastructure and economic growth in North Dakota.
